page.title: 02Hollinsclough School(past)
page.content: Sara Slack Age 9 The very first school that opened was the Â£Old Dame School'at Bank House. There were four or five children in this school. In 1873 the old barn next to the church was made into a school. November 10th,1873 there were only four children. Mrs.Gertie Mellor started school when she was six in 1911. She attended Hollinsclough School during World War 1. When she was at school this great big box came,the teacher opened it, it was full of wool which was for knitting for the soldiers. The young ones knitted scarves, bigger children knitted socks,then the next ones knitted gloves and the very big ones knitted baraclavers. Sometimes a boy or girl would fall over in the lesson beacause they had not had enough to eat.
